title: What are the skills that would be in demand 20+ years from now? - Quora

response.answer_text: Most of the people wanting human contact for key services functions, like Law, medicine and even sale - will be dead or senile whilst their Millennial progeny - who were raised on apps, smartphones and distributed conversation via text or video - will be firmly in charge. Skills in demand will look to build, evolve and deploy ever more effective User Interfaces, systems coders, and data sciences. Unfortunately - for the blue collar set - I see no diminution in demand for soldiers as the consequences of global warming - lack of fresh water, disease, fires, floods roil the environment - starving some societies and forcing resource starved neighbors to resort to war.

Engineering, except for Nuclear. Economists, especially macroeconomists. Accountants, particularly tax and estate knowledgeable ones. Estate Attorneys. Financial advisors, particularly those advising and managing the affairs of our aging population. Elder Attorneys. Personnel for assisted living facilities. Delivery services for food both fresh and prepared, beyond today’s backseat deliveries.
